Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: JayBey
Reviews.Content: Amazing for the price.  Simply amazing.  Not a gopro. But for the money, I could not be happier. Also half the weight of the gopro. Works great on my quad.

Reviews.Title: Great little dash camera.
Reviews.Author: Darth Hongs
Reviews.Content: I am using this item with a 32GB microSDHC card.The camera takes very nice videos, i even set up the video to take videos in 5 minute intervals.  The audio is decent, but not using this for its audio.

Reviews.Title: It works
Reviews.Author: Leonard M Whidby
Reviews.Content: Does what it says it will. Its a great little spy camera. The sound was better than I thought it would be.

Reviews.Title: This is great
Reviews.Author: JPC
Reviews.Content: I use it as a downlink camera on my FPV setup with a GoPro on the gimbal. I think the GoPro handles high contrast and low lighting better (low setting sun, for example) than the Mobius but you get a lot in a very small package and I'm certainly not disappointed with it for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Dashcam!!
Reviews.Author: Photoknut "Photoknut"
Reviews.Content: I have one of these in each of my cars and am thrilled with them.  They are so much more compact than my previous dashcams, and the clarity is amazing.  I have edited a number of my videos to post up online.  Images are so clear you can easily read license plates.  There is a fantastic user community that supports these cameras in all their uses.  The developers are tuned into these groups and listen to the feedback.  Very cool to have such great input into the success of a device.  Highly recommend this camera.  very easy to setup and use.

Reviews.Title: High quality, low price, great features!
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: Best dash can you can buy for the money! Great day and night quality, no useless features like screens or LEDs, and firmware updates quite often. This camera is smaller than a box of tic tacs yet records better than some cameras twice its size. It mounts very stealthily behind a rearview mirror, or anywhere for that matter. The GUI interface is very simple to use and allows for both a basic and advanced user to adjust essential settings. This camera is also very popular for rc plane and helicopter enthusiasts due to its microscopic size. All things considered for a chinise no name camera, this thing is very high quality.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Enealio
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best pieces of tech I’ve purchased for my bike. As a bike commuter in Los Angeles, I’m happy at all of the tech becoming available to make biking safer. I was recently in an altercation with a motorist and I had no video documentation of the incident. So after looking around at cameras, it came down this this and a GoPro.Pros:• Super lightweight. I wear it as a helmet cam. You won’t even know the thing is there. Plus it’s size makes it easy to just throw in your pocket when you get done with a ride.• It’s horizontal instead of vertical. What I mean by that is look at someone with a GoPro on their helmet. That that sticks up like a billboard. Not sleek and I wonder about the wind resistance. Especially if I were to place one on my scooter helmet. With the Mobius, it lays flat and well out of the way.• Crazy customization options. Download the software, the company must be filled with makers and tinkerers. The amount of customization options is mindblowing. And they often release firmware updates with new exciting options.• Decent battery life. I’m running it with a 32gb class 10 Sony card and I’m getting about an hour and fifteen minutes on a charge. That’s not bad. I’m not sure what GoPro gets but a friend with a first gen GP is barely making it to 45 min on a charge.• Excellent video quality. There are plenty of youtube videos out there showing the quality. They tell the truth. I purchased my Mobius with a wide angle lens to capture more of my surroundings. Excellent quality. I can pause it and easily read a license plate.• The price. Less than a hundred bucks? Totally a steal.Cons:• No image stabilization. So it could get a bit shaky. As mentioned, I mount mine to my helmet so the shakiness isn’t that bad. If this were handlebar mounted I expect it would be a rough video to watch.• No waterproof case yet. They do sell a case to help protect it from the environment but since I’ve read reports about the heat sinks getting pretty hot, I would worry about putting that on.• I don’t care for the material that coats the camera. I understand that it’s a bit rubbery to help if you drop it but I wanted this camera to be as low profile on my head as possible and wanted to use some super strong Velcro. Unfortunately, I can’t get anything to stick to the camera. So I’ll be getting some mounts instead. Not a big deal. Just a personal preference for me.• It’s so small, fellow bikers are always asking about it. Ok, that’s not really a con. Unless I’m in a rush.I 100% recommend this camera. For bicycling, for scootering, for motorcycles, as a dash cam, for sports, you name it. You won’t be disappointed.
